info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:59PM MDT until May 18 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM MDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CHEYENNE COUNTY IN EAST CENTRAL COLORADO... At 357 PM MDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 7 miles southeast of Boyero, or 30 miles south of Flagler, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. At 3:51 PM MT, hail up to one-inch in size was reported on Highway 94 south of Boyero, CO. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Wild Horse and Aroya. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
